intro: Houstonia bouvardioides, commonly known as the pink bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. It produces small, bladder-like structures that aid in its unique method of nutrient absorption. Houstonia bouvardioides is a short-lived perennial that thrives in humid, shaded environments.
